intro: Gordonia hirta, commonly known as the woolly gordonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces showy white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Gordonia hirta is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories.
